Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 10-inch casserole dish.

Directions.2: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add shells and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 9 minutes.

Directions.3: While the pasta is cooking, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk in flour and stir until the mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, 2 to 4 minutes. Gradually whisk milk, salt, and pepper into the flour mixture, and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook, whisking constantly, until the sauce is thick and smooth and coats the back of a spoon, 5 to 10 minutes.

Directions.4: Drain pasta and transfer to a large bowl. Pour cheese sauce over top, and mix until thoroughly combined. Transfer mixture to the prepared casserole dish.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 15 minutes.
